alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 8:10PM EST until January 07 at 6:08AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Black Creek At Quinby affecting Florence and Darlington Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek At Quinby. * WHEN...From late tonight to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Floodwaters continue to rise on Creekside Drive and East Black Creek Road with water nearing a few homes. Homes along East Black Creek Road become isolated and residents must use boats to exit the neighborhood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 12.6 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.6 feet on 03/22/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=ilm The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 215 PM EST.
